title: Installation issue: openpmd-api / gmp
body:
Hi,

I've been trying to install and run code with the `spack` module `openpmd-api`, but have found a `HDF5`-apparent error message with it (reported in https://github.com/openPMD/openPMD-api/issues/1021).

@ax3l has been helping me and suggested that I tried to use `spack` environments instead.
Although all the modules were installed via `spack`, when installing them in a new environment, `zstd` was re-installed, and `gmp` was starting to be installed, but gave an error message (which is why I am writing this issue and which I don't know how to solve).

### Steps to reproduce the issue

Initial installation of packages:
```console
$ spack install gcc
$ spack compiler find
$ spack load gcc
$ spack compiler find
$ spack install cmake
$ spack load cmake
$ spack install mpich
$ spack load mpich
$  spack install openpmd-api
```

Creation of the environment (ending with `gmp` installation error):
```console
$ spack env create opmd
$  spack env activate opmd
$  spack add cmake
$ spack add mpich
$  spack add gcc
$  spack add openpmd-api
$  spack concretize
$  spack find -c
$  spack install
```

Error messages and more detailed view of what I did/got are in:
[spack_env_shell.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/6715097/spack_env_shell.txt)

### Information on my (Windows 10 local machine) system

```console
$ spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.16.2-3140-ca1d1c427c
* **Python:** 3.8.2
* **Platform:** linux-ubuntu20.04-skylake
* **Concretizer:** original
```

I have changed *spack/etc/spack/defaults/packages.yaml* line to `mpi: [mpich, openmpi]` to build with mpich by default.

### Additional information

<!-- Please upload the following files. They should be present in the stage directory of the failing build. Also upload any config.log or similar file if one exists. -->
* [[spack-build-env.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/6715090/spack-build-env.txt)

@ ax3l
